required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Thromboelastography-derived Functional Fibrinogen Levels During and After Cardiopulmonary Bypass

brief_summary.textblock: This study hopes to determine if thromboelastography-derived functional fibrinogen (TEG-FF or FLEV) levels obtained during the rewarming phase of cardiopulmonary bypass can provide information on coagulation status sooner, allowing for anticipation of post-bypass bleeding and transfusion requirements

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Thromboelastography-derived Functional Fibrinogen Level (FLEV)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in FLEV from rewarming and after cardiopulmonary bypass
primary_outcome.description: FLEV values obtained during rewarming while on cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) were compared to FLEV values obtained immediately after CPB and protamine administration. For all patients included, the mean values for rewarming FLEV and mean values for post-CPB FLEV were obtained. If the mean difference for the two timepoints was not statistically different by t-test, then the primary outcome would demonstrate the value of obtaining a rewarming FLEV sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in Clauss Assay and FLEV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Clauss vs FLEV for rewarming and post-CPB
secondary_outcome.description: This secondary outcome aimed to determine if standard laboratory assays for fibrinogen (Clauss) provided values similar to TEG-based functional fibrinogen (FLEV). The difference between the means at various timepoints is calculated in mg/dL.

clinical_study.condition: Coagulation Status of Cardiac Surgery Patient

study_pop.textblock: The population for this study will be elective cardiac surgical patients who will be undergoing elective primary cardiac surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elective cardiac surgery patients who are undergoing primary cardiac surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergency surgery
- Re-operative cardiac surgery
- History of hypercoagulable state as defined in medical record
- Anticoagulated status at time of surgery
- Plasma requirement prior to discontinuation of bypass (alters fibrinogen level)

group.title: Cardiac Surgery With Cardiopulmary Bypass
group.description: Patients over the age of 18 years undergoing cardiac surgery requiring CPB. Patients were excluded based on their need for emergency surgery, re-operative cardiac surgery, a history of coagulation disorders, and inability to sign consent.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: 2 patients excluded due to FFP given.

group.title: Cardiac Surgery With Cardiopulmary Bypass
group.description: patients over the age of 18 years undergoing cardiac surgery requiring CPB. patients were excluded based on their need for emergency surgery, re-operative cardiac surgery, a history of coagulation disorders, and inability to sign consent.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Change in Thromboelastography-derived Functional Fibrinogen Level (FLEV)
outcome.description: FLEV values obtained during rewarming while on cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) were compared to FLEV values obtained immediately after CPB and protamine administration. For all patients included, the mean values for rewarming FLEV and mean values for post-CPB FLEV were obtained. If the mean difference for the two timepoints was not statistically different by t-test, then the primary outcome would demonstrate the value of obtaining a rewarming FLEV sample.
outcome.time_frame: Change in FLEV from rewarming and after cardiopulmonary bypass
outcome.population: 49 patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB.

group.title: FLEV Difference During Rewarming & Post-cardiopulmonary Bypass
group.description: All enrolled patients were in a single arm with multiple timepoints. FLEV values were obtained at baseline, rewarming, and post-CPB. The primary outcome was to compare the rewarming and post-CPB values to determine if a significant difference exists.

measure.title: Change in Thromboelastography-derived Functional Fibrinogen Level (FLEV)
measure.description: FLEV values obtained during rewarming while on cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) were compared to FLEV values obtained immediately after CPB and protamine administration. For all patients included, the mean values for rewarming FLEV and mean values for post-CPB FLEV were obtained. If the mean difference for the two timepoints was not statistically different by t-test, then the primary outcome would demonstrate the value of obtaining a rewarming FLEV sample.
measure.population: 49 patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB.

outcome.title: Difference in Clauss Assay and FLEV
outcome.description: This secondary outcome aimed to determine if standard laboratory assays for fibrinogen (Clauss) provided values similar to TEG-based functional fibrinogen (FLEV). The difference between the means at various timepoints is calculated in mg/dL.
outcome.time_frame: Clauss vs FLEV for rewarming and post-CPB
outcome.population: 49 patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB. The measure is the difference of the FLEV and the Clauss assay (i.e. FLEV minus Clauss since the FLEV is consistently higher).

group.title: Clauss vs FLEV at Rewarming and Post-CPB
group.description: All enrolled patients were in a single arm with multiple timepoints. Clauss assay and FLEV values were obtained at baseline, rewarming, and post-CPB. The secondary outcome was to compare the rewarming and post-CPB values of Clauss value to FLEV to determine if a significant difference exists.

measure.title: Difference in Clauss Assay and FLEV
measure.description: This secondary outcome aimed to determine if standard laboratory assays for fibrinogen (Clauss) provided values similar to TEG-based functional fibrinogen (FLEV). The difference between the means at various timepoints is calculated in mg/dL.
measure.population: 49 patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB. The measure is the difference of the FLEV and the Clauss assay (i.e. FLEV minus Clauss since the FLEV is consistently higher).

class.title: Mean Clauss vs FLEV difference at rewarming
Mean Clauss vs FLEV difference post-CPB

group.title: Cardiac Surgery With Cardiopulmary Bypass
group.description: patients over the age of 18 years undergoing cardiac surgery requiring CPB. patients were excluded based on their need for emergency surgery, re-operative cardiac surgery, a history of coagulation disorders, and inability to sign consent.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
